column5: Decided to go to Eagle this morning for a few hours.New black top right to launch pad.Got one muskie almost right away.Few follows and a bunch of pike.Beautifull out and very calm,with some smoke.Enjoyed a nice swim on little beach and no boats on lake.That should change soon.

What part of the lake were you on East or West basins? Water level? How many public launches would you say are on the lake I know of one towards Vermillion Bay and one not far from Eagle River? Thinking of renting a cottage and meeting a guide at a local launch site if one is near a rental property. Thanks
Thanks for posting the pictures John, looks like a peaceful day.
Pretty calm day.Dont get many lately but very enjoyable.
Thanks for the pictures. Counting the days, Take care.

John, do you know Jim and Cindi from Eagle Lake Sportsmans Lodge? They are salt of the earth folks. Really enjoyed my stay there several years ago. We also stayed at that mouse infested Buzzard Falls cabin one year. Had good luck on musky and walleye down on that far end of the lake.
My first trips to Canada were back in the 90â€™s and the Vermillion Bay area. Always stayed at Deer Trail Lodge. Lots of good memories!Thanks for sharing!
